channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A look back at Congress' tumultuous year
item.description: Congress kicked off 2025 with an ambitious agenda, but 12 months later, it has ceded much of its power to President Trump and passed a record low number of bills.
item.content:encoded: Congress kicked off 2025 with an ambitious agenda, but 12 months later, it has ceded much of its power to President Trump and passed a record low number of bills.
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Republican strategist talks about what the future holds for the GOP
item.description: Morning Edition host Leila Fadel asks GOP strategist Alex Conant about the future of the Republican party in 2026 and beyond.
item.content:encoded: Morning Edition host Leila Fadel asks GOP strategist Alex Conant about the future of the Republican party in 2026 and beyond.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Louvre installs bars over gallery windows in latest security measure post-heist
item.description: France's Louvre museum has installed large metal bars over the windows of the gallery thieves broke into in October.
item.content:encoded: France's Louvre museum has installed large metal bars over the windows of the gallery thieves broke into in October.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Amanda Seyfried's tally for 2025: 3 starring roles, 2 Golden Globe nominations
item.description: Amanda Seyfried is up for a Golden Globe for her performance in The Testament of Ann Lee, a movie musical about the leader of the Shakers, the 18th-century religious movement that preached celibacy, gender and racial equality, and pacifism.
item.content:encoded:
Amanda Seyfried is up for a Golden Globe for her performance in The Testament of Ann Lee, a movie musical about the leader of the Shakers, the 18th-century religious movement that preached celibacy, gender and racial equality, and pacifism.

(Image credit: Searchlight Pictures/Searchlight Pictures)
item.dc:creator: Phil Harrell

item.title: Christmas is over. Here's what to do with your holiday trash
item.description: Household waste increases by 25% between Thanksgiving and New Years. Rules vary by municipality on what you can recycle and what needs to go into the trash.
item.content:encoded:
Household waste increases by 25% between Thanksgiving and New Years. Rules vary by municipality on what you can recycle and what needs to go into the trash.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ava Pukatch

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump announces U.S. strikes against ISIS targets in Nigeria, a look back at Congress' tumultuous year, holiday spending is expected to be strong despite low consumer confidence.
item.content:encoded: Trump announces U.S. strikes against ISIS targets in Nigeria, a look back at Congress' tumultuous year, holiday spending is expected to be strong despite low consumer confidence.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Ex-State Dept. official on likelihood Kurdish forces join Syrian army before deadline
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks former State Department official Wa'el Alzayat about the prospects of Kurdish forces reaching an agreement to join the Syrian army ahead of an end-of-year deadline.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel asks former State Department official Wa'el Alzayat about the prospects of Kurdish forces reaching an agreement to join the Syrian army ahead of an end-of-year deadline.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Clean energy is surging despite political attacks. But a slowdown may be looming
item.description: Over the past year, the Trump administration and Congressional Republicans have waged a sweeping campaign against America's renewable energy industry. At least for now, though, clean energy is still booming in the United States.
item.content:encoded: Over the past year, the Trump administration and Congressional Republicans have waged a sweeping campaign against America's renewable energy industry. At least for now, though, clean energy is still booming in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: With insurance prices increase, women figure out coverage options for their families
item.description: Figuring out the insurance puzzle for families often falls to women. Some say they're delaying marriage, taking side jobs and putting their kids on Medicaid as premium prices shoot up in 2026.
item.content:encoded: Figuring out the insurance puzzle for families often falls to women. Some say they're delaying marriage, taking side jobs and putting their kids on Medicaid as premium prices shoot up in 2026.
item.dc:creator: Lynn Arditi

item.title: How eating greens became a holiday tradition for many African-American families
item.description: Morning Edition host Michel Martin talks with food historian Jessica B. Harris about the history of eating greens during the holidays and how it became a tradition for many African-American families.
item.content:encoded: Morning Edition host Michel Martin talks with food historian Jessica B. Harris about the history of eating greens during the holidays and how it became a tradition for many African-American families.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin
